config_defs.name: kafka.topic
config_defs.documentation: The Kafka topic to publish records to.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: The number of records that should be returned with each batch.Type: intDefault: 1000Importance: medium

config_defs.name: empty.poll.wait.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait if a poll returns an empty list of records.Type: longDefault: 10000Importance: low

config_defs.name: topic.creation.groups
config_defs.documentation: A list of group aliases that are used to define per-group topic configurations for matching topics. Adefaultgroup always exists and matches all topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: The values of this property refer to any additional groups. Adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: the values of this property refer to any additional groups. adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for new topics created by the connector. This value must not be larger than the number of brokers in the Kafka cluster. If this value is larger than the number of Kafka brokers, an error occurs when the connector attempts to create a topic. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.partitions
config_defs.documentation: The number of topic partitions created by this connector. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.include
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings that represent regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to include topics with matching values, and apply this groupâs specific configuration to the matching topics.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.exclude
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings representing regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to exclude topics with matching values from getting the groupâs specfic configuration.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup. Note that exclusion rules override any inclusion rules for topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.${kafkaTopicSpecificConfigName}
config_defs.documentation: Any of theChanging Broker Configurations Dynamicallyfor the version of the Kafka broker where the records will be written. The brokerâs topic-level configuration value is used if the configuration is not specified for the rule.$aliasapplies to thedefaultgroup as well as any group defined intopic.creation.groups.Type: property valuesDefault: Kafka broker value

config_defs.name: key.schema
config_defs.documentation: The schema for the key written to Kafka.Type: stringDefault: {ânameâ:âdefault-key-schemaâ,âtypeâ:âSTRUCTâ,âisOptionalâ:false,âfieldSchemasâ:{âfilePathâ:{âtypeâ:âSTRINGâ,âisOptionalâ:true}}}Importance: medium

config_defs.name: value.schema
config_defs.documentation: The schema for the value written to Kafka.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if schemas should be dynamically generated. If set to true,key.schemaandvalue.schemacan be omitted, butschema.generation.key.nameandschema.generation.value.namemust be set. Nested JSON is currently not supported and will be ignored. Schemaless JSON parsing should be used instead.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.key.fields
config_defs.documentation: The field(s) to use to build a key schema. This is used only during schema generation.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.key.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the generated key schema.Type: stringDefault: default_key_schema_nameImportance: low

config_defs.name: schema.generation.value.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the generated value schema.Type: stringDefault: default_value_schema_nameImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.timestamp.mode
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector will set the timestamp for the Source Record. If set toFIELD, then the timestamp will be read from a field in the value. Specify the field  inftps.timestamp.field. If set toFILE_TIME, then the last modified time of the file will be used. If set toPROCESS_TIME, the time the record is read will be used.Type: stringDefault: PROCESS_TIMEValid Values: one of [FIELD, FILE_TIME, PROCESS_TIME]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: process_timevalid values: one of [field, file_time, process_time]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation: The field in the value schema that will contain the parsed timestamp for the record. This field cannot be marked as optional and must be a Timestamp.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.host
config_defs.documentation: The address of the FTPS server.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.username
config_defs.documentation: The username used to authenticate with the file server.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.password
config_defs.documentation: The password used to authenticate with the file server.Type: passwordImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.port
config_defs.documentation: Port number of the FTPS server.Type: intDefault: 21Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.security.mode
config_defs.documentation: The mode used to connect with the server. This is related to the establishment of the TLS connection and is up to the client.Type: stringDefault: EXPLICITValid Values: one of [EXPLICIT, IMPLICIT]Importance: low
config_defs.default: explicitvalid values: one of [explicit, implicit]importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.server.timezone
config_defs.documentation: The timezone on the FTPS server. This is used when calculating the age of a file.Type: stringDefault: UTCValid Values: Should be one of the identifiers used byjava.util.TimeZoneto refer to time zones, for example, America/Chicago or UTC.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utcvalid values: should be one of the identifiers used byjava.util.timezoneto refer to time zones, for example, america/chicago or utc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.input.path
config_defs.documentation: The FTPS directory to read files that will be processed.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.input.file.pattern
config_defs.documentation: Regular expression to check input file names against. This expression must match the entire filename.Type: stringDefault: .+Importance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.error.path
config_defs.documentation: The FTPS directory to place files that have errors.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.finished.path
config_defs.documentation: The FTPS directory to place files that have been successfully processed.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.behavior.on.error
config_defs.documentation: Specifies whether the task should halt when it encounters an error or continue to the next file.Type: stringDefault: LOGValid Values: one of [LOG, IGNORE, FAIL]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: logvalid values: one of [log, ignore, fail]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.schemaless.json.parsing
config_defs.documentation: To specify whether JSON files should be parsed without using any schema. Needed only when JSON is one of file types specified in file.types.to.parse.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ignore.file.extension
config_defs.documentation: By default, the parser to use for a file is chosen based on the fileâs extension. Instead, if a single parser is to be used for each file, regardless of extension, this property should be set to true. In that case, the parser specified in parser.type will be used for parsing all files.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.parser.type
config_defs.documentation: The parser to use for parsing files. Required only ifftps.ignore.file.extensionistrue.Type: stringDefault: TXTValid Values: one of [TXT, CSV, JSON]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: txtvalid values: one of [txt, csv, json]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.cleanup.policy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector should cleanup the files that have been successfully processed. NONE leaves the files in place which could cause them to be reprocessed if the connector is restarted. DELETE removes the file from the filesystem. MOVE will move the file to a finished directory.Type: stringDefault: NONEValid Values: one of [DELETE, MOVE, NONE]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: one of [delete, move, none]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.file.minimum.age.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds after the file was last written to before the file can be processed.Type: longDefault: 0Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the truststore file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the truststore file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.1,TLSv1Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. Default setting is TLS, which is fine for most cases. Allowed values in recent JVMs are TLS, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. SSL, SSLv2 and SSLv3 may be supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security vulnerabilities.Type: stringDefault: TLSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the truststore file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.cipher.suites
config_defs.documentation: A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication, encryption, MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server certificate.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: SunX509Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The algorithm used by trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.txt.file.charset
config_defs.documentation: Character set to read a text file with.Type: stringDefault: UTF-8Valid Values: Should be a valid charset such as UTF-8, UTF-16, IBM01147 etc.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utf-8valid values: should be a valid charset such as utf-8, utf-16, ibm01147 etc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.first.row.as.header
config_defs.documentation: Flag to indicate if the fist row of data contains the header of the file. If true the position of the columns will be determined by the first row to the CSV. The column position will be inferred from the position of the schema supplied invalue.schema. If set to true the number of columns must be greater than or equal to the number of fields in the schema and the first row, which is the header, will be used to set the field names in the generated schema ifschema.generation.enabledis set to true.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.separator.char
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates each field in the form of an integer. Typically in a CSV this is a ,(44) character. A TSV would use a tab(9) character. Ifftps.csv.separator.charis defined as a null(0), then the RFC 4180 parser must be utilized by default. This is the equivalent offtps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled=true.Type: intDefault: 44Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.case.sensitive.field.names
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the field names in the header row should be treated as case sensitive.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the RFC 4180 parser should be used instead of the default parser.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.escape.char
config_defs.documentation: The character as an integer to use when a special character is encountered. The default escape character is typically a (92).Type: intDefault: 92Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.file.charset
config_defs.documentation: Character set to read the file with.Type: stringDefault: UTF-8Valid Values: Should be a valid charset such as UTF-8, UTF-16, IBM01147 etc.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utf-8valid values: should be a valid charset such as utf-8, utf-16, ibm01147 etc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.leading.whitespace
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore leading whitespace setting - if true, white space in front of a quote in a field is ignored.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.quotations
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore quotations mode - if true, quotations are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.keep.carriage.return
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the carriage return at the end of the line should be maintained.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.null.field.indicator
config_defs.documentation: Indicator to determine how the CSV Reader can determine if a field is null. Valid values are EMPTY_SEPARATORS, EMPTY_QUOTES, BOTH, or NEITHER. For more information seehttp://opencsv.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/opencsv/enums/CSVReaderNullFieldIndicator.html.Type: stringDefault: NEITHERValid Values: one of [NEITHER, EMPTY_SEPARATORS, EMPTY_QUOTES, BOTH]Importance: low
config_defs.default: neithervalid values: one of [neither, empty_separators, empty_quotes, both]importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.quote.char
config_defs.documentation: The character that is used to quote a field. This typically happens when the ftps.csv.separator.char character is within the data.Type: intDefault: 34Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.skip.lines
config_defs.documentation: Number of lines to skip in the beginning of the file.Type: intDefault: 0Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.strict.quotes
config_defs.documentation: Sets the strict quotes setting - if true, characters outside the quotes are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation: Confluent will issue a license key to each subscriber. The license key will be a short snippet of text that you can copy and paste. Without the license key, you can use the connector for a 30-day trial period. If you are a subscriber, contactConfluent Supportfor more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the formhost1:port1,host2:port2,.... These servers are used only for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership, which may change dynamically, so this list need not contain the full set of servers. You may want more than one, in case a server is down.Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.documentation:

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.input.file.pattern
config_defs.documentation: Regular expression to check input file names against. This expression must match the entire filename.Type: stringDefault: .+Importance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.error.path
config_defs.documentation: The FTPS directory to place files that have errors.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.finished.path
config_defs.documentation: The FTPS directory to place files that have been successfully processed.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.behavior.on.error
config_defs.documentation: Specifies whether the task should halt when it encounters an error or continue to the next file.Type: stringDefault: LOGValid Values: one of [LOG, IGNORE, FAIL]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: logvalid values: one of [log, ignore, fail]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.schemaless.json.parsing
config_defs.documentation: To specify whether JSON files should be parsed without using any schema. Needed only when JSON is one of file types specified in file.types.to.parse.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ignore.file.extension
config_defs.documentation: By default, the parser to use for a file is chosen based on the fileâs extension. Instead, if a single parser is to be used for each file, regardless of extension, this property should be set to true. In that case, the parser specified in parser.type will be used for parsing all files.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.parser.type
config_defs.documentation: The parser to use for parsing files. Required only ifftps.ignore.file.extensionistrue.Type: stringDefault: TXTValid Values: one of [TXT, CSV, JSON]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: txtvalid values: one of [txt, csv, json]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.cleanup.policy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector should cleanup the files that have been successfully processed. NONE leaves the files in place which could cause them to be reprocessed if the connector is restarted. DELETE removes the file from the filesystem. MOVE will move the file to a finished directory.Type: stringDefault: NONEValid Values: one of [DELETE, MOVE, NONE]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: one of [delete, move, none]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.file.minimum.age.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds after the file was last written to before the file can be processed.Type: longDefault: 0Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the truststore file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the truststore file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.1,TLSv1Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. Default setting is TLS, which is fine for most cases. Allowed values in recent JVMs are TLS, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. SSL, SSLv2 and SSLv3 may be supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security vulnerabilities.Type: stringDefault: TLSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the truststore file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.cipher.suites
config_defs.documentation: A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication, encryption, MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server certificate.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: SunX509Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The algorithm used by trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.txt.file.charset
config_defs.documentation: Character set to read a text file with.Type: stringDefault: UTF-8Valid Values: Should be a valid charset such as UTF-8, UTF-16, IBM01147 etc.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utf-8valid values: should be a valid charset such as utf-8, utf-16, ibm01147 etc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.first.row.as.header
config_defs.documentation: Flag to indicate if the fist row of data contains the header of the file. If true the position of the columns will be determined by the first row to the CSV. The column position will be inferred from the position of the schema supplied invalue.schema. If set to true the number of columns must be greater than or equal to the number of fields in the schema and the first row, which is the header, will be used to set the field names in the generated schema ifschema.generation.enabledis set to true.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.separator.char
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates each field in the form of an integer. Typically in a CSV this is a ,(44) character. A TSV would use a tab(9) character. Ifftps.csv.separator.charis defined as a null(0), then the RFC 4180 parser must be utilized by default. This is the equivalent offtps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled=true.Type: intDefault: 44Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.case.sensitive.field.names
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the field names in the header row should be treated as case sensitive.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the RFC 4180 parser should be used instead of the default parser.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.escape.char
config_defs.documentation: The character as an integer to use when a special character is encountered. The default escape character is typically a (92).Type: intDefault: 92Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.file.charset
config_defs.documentation: Character set to read the file with.Type: stringDefault: UTF-8Valid Values: Should be a valid charset such as UTF-8, UTF-16, IBM01147 etc.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utf-8valid values: should be a valid charset such as utf-8, utf-16, ibm01147 etc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.leading.whitespace
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore leading whitespace setting - if true, white space in front of a quote in a field is ignored.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.quotations
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore quotations mode - if true, quotations are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.keep.carriage.return
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the carriage return at the end of the line should be maintained.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.null.field.indicator
config_defs.documentation: Indicator to determine how the CSV Reader can determine if a field is null. Valid values are EMPTY_SEPARATORS, EMPTY_QUOTES, BOTH, or NEITHER. For more information seehttp://opencsv.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/opencsv/enums/CSVReaderNullFieldIndicator.html.Type: stringDefault: NEITHERValid Values: one of [NEITHER, EMPTY_SEPARATORS, EMPTY_QUOTES, BOTH]Importance: low
config_defs.default: neithervalid values: one of [neither, empty_separators, empty_quotes, both]importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.quote.char
config_defs.documentation: The character that is used to quote a field. This typically happens when the ftps.csv.separator.char character is within the data.Type: intDefault: 34Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.skip.lines
config_defs.documentation: Number of lines to skip in the beginning of the file.Type: intDefault: 0Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.strict.quotes
config_defs.documentation: Sets the strict quotes setting - if true, characters outside the quotes are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation: Confluent will issue a license key to each subscriber. The license key will be a short snippet of text that you can copy and paste. Without the license key, you can use the connector for a 30-day trial period. If you are a subscriber, contactConfluent Supportfor more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the formhost1:port1,host2:port2,.... These servers are used only for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership, which may change dynamically, so this list need not contain the full set of servers. You may want more than one, in case a server is down.Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but
integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Valid values are: PLAINTEXT, SSL, SASL_PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL.Type: stringDefault: âPLAINTEXTâImportance: medium

config_defs.name: kafka.topic
config_defs.documentation: The Kafka topic to publish records to.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: The number of records that should be returned with each batch.Type: intDefault: 1000Importance: medium

config_defs.name: empty.poll.wait.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait if a poll returns an empty list of records.Type: longDefault: 10000Importance: low

config_defs.name: topic.creation.groups
config_defs.documentation: A list of group aliases that are used to define per-group topic configurations for matching topics. Adefaultgroup always exists and matches all topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: The values of this property refer to any additional groups. Adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: the values of this property refer to any additional groups. adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for new topics created by the connector. This value must not be larger than the number of brokers in the Kafka cluster. If this value is larger than the number of Kafka brokers, an error occurs when the connector attempts to create a topic. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.partitions
config_defs.documentation: The number of topic partitions created by this connector. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.include
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings that represent regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to include topics with matching values, and apply this groupâs specific configuration to the matching topics.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.exclude
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings representing regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to exclude topics with matching values from getting the groupâs specfic configuration.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup. Note that exclusion rules override any inclusion rules for topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.${kafkaTopicSpecificConfigName}
config_defs.documentation: Any of theChanging Broker Configurations Dynamicallyfor the version of the Kafka broker where the records will be written. The brokerâs topic-level configuration value is used if the configuration is not specified for the rule.$aliasapplies to thedefaultgroup as well as any group defined intopic.creation.groups.Type: property valuesDefault: Kafka broker value

Schemaless JSON parsing should be used instead.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.key.fields

config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector will set the timestamp for the Source Record. If set toFIELD, then the timestamp will be read from a field in the value. Specify the field  inftps.timestamp.field. If set toFILE_TIME, then the last modified time of the file will be used. If set toPROCESS_TIME, the time the record is read will be used.Type: stringDefault: PROCESS_TIMEValid Values: one of [FIELD, FILE_TIME, PROCESS_TIME]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: process_timevalid values: one of [field, file_time, process_time]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation: The field in the value schema that will contain the parsed timestamp for the record. This field cannot be marked as optional and must be a Timestamp.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.leading.whitespace

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.quotations
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore quotations mode - if true, quotations are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.keep.carriage.return

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.quote.char

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.skip.lines
config_defs.documentation: Number of lines to skip in the beginning of the file.Type: intDefault: 0Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.strict.quotes
config_defs.documentation: Sets the strict quotes setting - if true, characters outside the quotes are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation: Confluent will issue a license key to each subscriber. The license key will be a short snippet of text that you can copy and paste. Without the license key, you can use the connector for a 30-day trial period. If you are a subscriber, contactConfluent Supportfor more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the formhost1:port1,host2:port2,.... These servers are used only for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership, which may change dynamically, so this list need not contain the full set of servers. You may want more than one, in case a server is down.Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but
integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Valid values are: PLAINTEXT, SSL, SASL_PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL.Type: stringDefault: âPLAINTEXTâImportance: medium

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: The number of records that should be returned with each batch.Type: intDefault: 1000Importance: medium

config_defs.name: empty.poll.wait.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait if a poll returns an empty list of records.Type: longDefault: 10000Importance: low

config_defs.name: topic.creation.groups
config_defs.documentation: A list of group aliases that are used to define per-group topic configurations for matching topics. Adefaultgroup always exists and matches all topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: The values of this property refer to any additional groups. Adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: the values of this property refer to any additional groups. adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for new topics created by the connector. This value must not be larger than the number of brokers in the Kafka cluster. If this value is larger than the number of Kafka brokers, an error occurs when the connector attempts to create a topic. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.partitions
config_defs.documentation: The number of topic partitions created by this connector. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.include
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings that represent regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to include topics with matching values, and apply this groupâs specific configuration to the matching topics.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.exclude
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings representing regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to exclude topics with matching values from getting the groupâs specfic configuration.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup. Note that exclusion rules override any inclusion rules for topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.${kafkaTopicSpecificConfigName}
config_defs.documentation: Any of theChanging Broker Configurations Dynamicallyfor the version of the Kafka broker where the records will be written. The brokerâs topic-level configuration value is used if the configuration is not specified for the rule.$aliasapplies to thedefaultgroup as well as any group defined intopic.creation.groups.Type: property valuesDefault: Kafka broker value

config_defs.documentation: The schema for the key written to Kafka.Type: stringDefault: {ânameâ:âdefault-key-schemaâ,âtypeâ:âSTRUCTâ,âisOptionalâ:false,âfieldSchemasâ:{âfilePathâ:{âtypeâ:âSTRINGâ,âisOptionalâ:true}}}Importance: medium

config_defs.name: value.schema
config_defs.documentation: The schema for the value written to Kafka.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if schemas should be dynamically generated. If set to true,key.schemaandvalue.schemacan be omitted, butschema.generation.key.nameandschema.generation.value.namemust be set. Nested JSON is currently not supported and will be ignored. Schemaless JSON parsing should be used instead.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.key.fields
config_defs.documentation: The field(s) to use to build a key schema. This is used only during schema generation.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.key.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the generated key schema.Type: stringDefault: default_key_schema_nameImportance: low

config_defs.name: schema.generation.value.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the generated value schema.Type: stringDefault: default_value_schema_nameImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.timestamp.mode
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector will set the timestamp for the Source Record. If set toFIELD, then the timestamp will be read from a field in the value. Specify the field  inftps.timestamp.field. If set toFILE_TIME, then the last modified time of the file will be used. If set toPROCESS_TIME, the time the record is read will be used.Type: stringDefault: PROCESS_TIMEValid Values: one of [FIELD, FILE_TIME, PROCESS_TIME]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: process_timevalid values: one of [field, file_time, process_time]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation: The field in the value schema that will contain the parsed timestamp for the record. This field cannot be marked as optional and must be a Timestamp.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.host
config_defs.documentation: The address of the FTPS server.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.username
config_defs.documentation: The username used to authenticate with the file server.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.password
config_defs.documentation: The password used to authenticate with the file server.Type: passwordImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.port
config_defs.documentation: Port number of the FTPS server.Type: intDefault: 21Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.default: explicitvalid values: one of [explicit, implicit]importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.server.timezone

config_defs.default: utcvalid values: should be one of the identifiers used byjava.util.timezoneto refer to time zones, for example, america/chicago or utc.importance: low

config_defs.documentation: The FTPS directory to read files that will be processed.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.default: logvalid values: one of [log, ignore, fail]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.schemaless.json.parsing

config_defs.name: ftps.ignore.file.extension
config_defs.documentation: By default, the parser to use for a file is chosen based on the fileâs extension. config_defs.documentation: The parser to use for parsing files. Required only ifftps.ignore.file.extensionistrue.Type: stringDefault: TXTValid Values: one of [TXT, CSV, JSON]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.cleanup.policy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector should cleanup the files that have been successfully processed. config_defs.default: nonevalid values: one of [delete, move, none]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.file.minimum.age.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds after the file was last written to before the file can be processed.Type: longDefault: 0Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation: Confluent will issue a license key to each subscriber. The license key will be a short snippet of text that you can copy and paste. Without the license key, you can use the connector for a 30-day trial period. If you are a subscriber, contactConfluent Supportfor more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the formhost1:port1,host2:port2,.... These servers are used only for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership, which may change dynamically, so this list need not contain the full set of servers. You may want more than one, in case a server is down.Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

Adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: the values of this property refer to any additional groups. adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for new topics created by the connector. This value must not be larger than the number of brokers in the Kafka cluster. If this value is larger than the number of Kafka brokers, an error occurs when the connector attempts to create a topic. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.partitions

Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.exclude

This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup. Note that exclusion rules override any inclusion rules for topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation: Confluent will issue a license key to each subscriber. The license key will be a short snippet of text that you can copy and paste. Without the license key, you can use the connector for a 30-day trial period. If you are a subscriber, contactConfluent Supportfor more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the formhost1:port1,host2:port2,.... These servers are used only for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership, which may change dynamically, so this list need not contain the full set of servers. You may want more than one, in case a server is down.Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.location

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password

config_defs.name: topic.creation.groups
config_defs.documentation: A list of group aliases that are used to define per-group topic configurations for matching topics. Adefaultgroup always exists and matches all topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: The values of this property refer to any additional groups. Adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: the values of this property refer to any additional groups. adefaultgroup is always defined for topic configurations.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for new topics created by the connector. This value must not be larger than the number of brokers in the Kafka cluster. If this value is larger than the number of Kafka brokers, an error occurs when the connector attempts to create a topic. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.partitions
config_defs.documentation: The number of topic partitions created by this connector. This is arequired propertyfor thedefaultgroup. This property is optional for any other group defined intopic.creation.groups. Other groups use the Kafka broker default value.Type: intDefault: n/aPossible Values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the Kafka brokerâs default value.
config_defs.default: n/apossible values:>=1for a specific valid value or-1to use the kafka brokerâs default value.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.include
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings that represent regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to include topics with matching values, and apply this groupâs specific configuration to the matching topics.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.exclude
config_defs.documentation: A list of strings representing regular expressions that match topic names. This list is used to exclude topics with matching values from getting the groupâs specfic configuration.$aliasapplies to any group defined intopic.creation.groups. This property does not apply to thedefaultgroup. Note that exclusion rules override any inclusion rules for topics.Type: List of String typesDefault: emptyPossible Values: Comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.
config_defs.default: emptypossible values: comma-separated list of exact topic names or regular expressions.

config_defs.name: topic.creation.$alias.${kafkaTopicSpecificConfigName}
config_defs.documentation: Any of theChanging Broker Configurations Dynamicallyfor the version of the Kafka broker where the records will be written. The brokerâs topic-level configuration value is used if the configuration is not specified for the rule.$aliasapplies to thedefaultgroup as well as any group defined intopic.creation.groups.Type: property valuesDefault: Kafka broker value

Schemaless JSON parsing should be used instead.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: medium

config_defs.name: schema.generation.key.fields
config_defs.documentation: The field(s) to use to build a key schema. This is used only during schema generation.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector will set the timestamp for the Source Record. If set toFIELD, then the timestamp will be read from a field in the value. If set toPROCESS_TIME, the time the record is read will be used.Type: stringDefault: PROCESS_TIMEValid Values: one of [FIELD, FILE_TIME, PROCESS_TIME]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: process_timevalid values: one of [field, file_time, process_time]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.host
config_defs.documentation: The address of the FTPS server.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.username
config_defs.documentation: The username used to authenticate with the file server.Type: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.password

config_defs.documentation: By default, the parser to use for a file is chosen based on the fileâs extension. config_defs.name: ftps.cleanup.policy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how the connector should cleanup the files that have been successfully processed. NONE leaves the files in place which could cause them to be reprocessed if the connector is restarted. DELETE removes the file from the filesystem. MOVE will move the file to a finished directory.Type: stringDefault: NONEValid Values: one of [DELETE, MOVE, NONE]Importance: medium
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: one of [delete, move, none]importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.file.minimum.age.ms
config_defs.documentation: The amount of time in milliseconds after the file was last written to before the file can be processed.Type: longDefault: 0Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the truststore file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the truststore file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.1,TLSv1Importance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. Default setting is TLS, which is fine for most cases. Allowed values in recent JVMs are TLS, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. SSL, SSLv2 and SSLv3 may be supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security vulnerabilities.Type: stringDefault: TLSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the truststore file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.cipher.suites
config_defs.documentation: A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication, encryption, MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server certificate.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: SunX509Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation: The algorithm used by trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.txt.file.charset
config_defs.documentation: Character set to read a text file with.Type: stringDefault: UTF-8Valid Values: Should be a valid charset such as UTF-8, UTF-16, IBM01147 etc.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utf-8valid values: should be a valid charset such as utf-8, utf-16, ibm01147 etc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.first.row.as.header
config_defs.documentation: Flag to indicate if the fist row of data contains the header of the file. If true the position of the columns will be determined by the first row to the CSV. The column position will be inferred from the position of the schema supplied invalue.schema. If set to true the number of columns must be greater than or equal to the number of fields in the schema and the first row, which is the header, will be used to set the field names in the generated schema ifschema.generation.enabledis set to true.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.separator.char
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates each field in the form of an integer. Typically in a CSV this is a ,(44) character. A TSV would use a tab(9) character. Ifftps.csv.separator.charis defined as a null(0), then the RFC 4180 parser must be utilized by default. This is the equivalent offtps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled=true.Type: intDefault: 44Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.case.sensitive.field.names
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the field names in the header row should be treated as case sensitive.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.rfc.4180.parser.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the RFC 4180 parser should be used instead of the default parser.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.escape.char
config_defs.documentation: The character as an integer to use when a special character is encountered. The default escape character is typically a (92).Type: intDefault: 92Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.file.charset
config_defs.documentation: Character set to read the file with.Type: stringDefault: UTF-8Valid Values: Should be a valid charset such as UTF-8, UTF-16, IBM01147 etc.Importance: low
config_defs.default: utf-8valid values: should be a valid charset such as utf-8, utf-16, ibm01147 etc.importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.leading.whitespace
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore leading whitespace setting - if true, white space in front of a quote in a field is ignored.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.ignore.quotations
config_defs.documentation: Sets the ignore quotations mode - if true, quotations are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.keep.carriage.return
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the carriage return at the end of the line should be maintained.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.null.field.indicator
config_defs.documentation: Indicator to determine how the CSV Reader can determine if a field is null. Valid values are EMPTY_SEPARATORS, EMPTY_QUOTES, BOTH, or NEITHER. For more information seehttp://opencsv.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/opencsv/enums/CSVReaderNullFieldIndicator.html.Type: stringDefault: NEITHERValid Values: one of [NEITHER, EMPTY_SEPARATORS, EMPTY_QUOTES, BOTH]Importance: low
config_defs.default: neithervalid values: one of [neither, empty_separators, empty_quotes, both]importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.quote.char
config_defs.documentation: The character that is used to quote a field. This typically happens when the ftps.csv.separator.char character is within the data.Type: intDefault: 34Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.skip.lines
config_defs.documentation: Number of lines to skip in the beginning of the file.Type: intDefault: 0Importance: low

config_defs.name: ftps.csv.strict.quotes
config_defs.documentation: Sets the strict quotes setting - if true, characters outside the quotes are ignored.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation: Confluent will issue a license key to each subscriber. The license key will be a short snippet of text that you can copy and paste. Without the license key, you can use the connector for a 30-day trial period. If you are a subscriber, contactConfluent Supportfor more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the formhost1:port1,host2:port2,.... These servers are used only for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership, which may change dynamically, so this list need not contain the full set of servers. You may want more than one, in case a server is down.Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but
integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high
